alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains and La Garita Mountains Including Wolf Creek Pass and Creede; San Luis Valley Including Alamosa, Del Norte, Fort Garland, Saguache; Southern Front Range Including Sangre De Cristo Mountains, Wet Mountains, La Veta Pass (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 2:40PM MDT until June 12 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 11 AM through 9 PM on Sunday for gusty winds and low relative humidity for Fire Weather Zones 223 and 224 and 225, which includes the eastern San Juan and La Garita Mountains, the San Luis Valley and all of the Southern Mountains... ...A Red Flag Warning has been issued from 11 AM through 8 PM on Monday for gusty winds and low relative humidity for Fire Weather Zones 223 and 224 and 225, which includes the eastern San Juan and La Garita Mountains, the San Luis Valley and all of the Southern Mountains... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 223...224 AND 225... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 223...224 AND 225... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 223...224 and 225. * Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Impacts... Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains and La Garita Mountains Including Wolf Creek Pass and Creede; San Luis Valley Including Alamosa, Del Norte, Fort Garland, Saguache; Southern Front Range Including Sangre De Cristo Mountains, Wet Mountains, La Veta Pass
